dataIdInfo.idPurp: Adds several fields to a copy of your polygon dataset that describe the shapes in terms of how they relate to a minimum bounding rectangle
dataIdInfo.idAbs:
Adds several fields to a copy of your polygon dataset that describe the shapes in terms of how they relate to a minimum bounding rectangle. The minimum bounding rectangle is optimally rotated so that in most cases it is the smallest rectangle possible (the algorithm was optimized for performance resulting in some cases where a less than 1% variance from optimal may occur).

The fields added are:

  • HullWidth: length of shortest axis

  • HullLength: length of longest axis

  • L2WRatio: ratio of HullLength to HullWidth (tells whether the input polygon is relatively compact or long)

  • MBRArea: percentage of the MBR's area that the original shape occupies (tells whether the input polygon is relatively substantial)

  • PartCount: just for quality assurance purposes, ideally the shapes should be single part--use the Multipart to singlepart tool if values greater than 1 appear in this column.

  • MBRBearing: bearing of the longest side of the polygon's minimum bounding rectangle. Measured clockwise from north (0 degrees).

The attributes in this script can be used as the basis for SQL queries in label classes in order to optimally assign polygon label placement styles. They can also be used to select features to be generalized; for example here they are used in conjunction with an Area field:

("AREASQKM" > 15 AND ( "RatioL2W" < 5 AND "MBR_Area" > 40)) OR (( "AREASQKM" > 75) AND ("RatioL2W" >= 5 AND "RatioL2W" < 12.5) AND "MBR_Area" > 30) OR (( "AREASQKM" > 75) AND ("RatioL2W" < 6) AND ("MBR_Area" > 6 AND "MBR_Area" < 30) ) OR (("AREASQKM" > 50) AND ("RatioL2W" >= 1 AND "RatioL2W" < 20) AND ("MBR_Area" > 5))

To adapt this query to your data, just scale the values based on the map scale you need.
